result.execSummary:
The defendant David Lorenz Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $3,566.56.  
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

No contact with Ms. Williams or Ella without prior agents approval.
No contact with minors under the age of 18 unless an and adult is present.

Submit a DNA sample and pay the costs. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

charges.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

supervisions.notes:
Pay costs. 
  25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Deemed satisfied.

records.addlTxt: Packet of letters of support for the defendant
from Tammy Bartosz

2:03 pm.
Defendant David Lorenz in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant David Lorenz in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report.  No corrections needed to the PSI report.  Court read the attachments that came with Atty Kryshak letter.  ADA Knaapen provides the Court two letters for review and informs the Court that Molly Williams (mother of the vicitm) wishes to speak today and provide a photo to the Court.  Court allows her to speak and provide photo.
2: 10 p.m. ADA Knaapen makes sentencing recommendations. 25 yr Prison Sentence at 15 yrs Incarceration and 10 yrs Extended Supervision: 
Atty Kryshak requests 10 yr Prison at 3 yrs In and 7 yr ES.
Defendant makes apologetic statements.

BY THE COURT:**********PRISON*************************
Count 1: Determinate Sentence 16 yrs Prison Sentence at 6 yrs Incarceration and 10 yrs Extended Supervision:
Extended Supervision Conditions:
No contact with Ms. Williams or Ella, without prior agent approval.
No contact with minors underage the age of 18 unless an adult present.
DNA sample and costs.
Pay costs.
  Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Pay Restitution from 25% prison account: $3,566.56 for Crime Victim Fund.
Not eligible for Challenge or Substance Abuse programs.
366 days credit.

Ct 2: 270 days jail, concurrent w/credit 366 day - deemed satisified.
Pay costs.

Informed of Appeal rights and information provided.
Defendant is remanded to Sheriff's department.
WIS JI-CRIMINAL 2108 and 2110

#P1 Photo of victim with C-collar neck brace
#P2 Photo of victim - right side of face 
#P3 Photo of victim - behind ear
#P4 Photo of victim - left side of face and older bruise
#P5 Photo of victim's eyes
#P6 Photo of victim's right ear
#P7 Copy of Medical Reports for victim E.W. from Ministry Saint Michael's Hospital 
#P8 Copy of MRI Test Report 
#D9 Copy of Internet Printout - Pain Scales/valuable Pain Assessment Tools 
#D10 Copy of Internet Printout of a Glasgow Trauma Score Sheet
#P11 CD start 13:13 to 14:46
#D12 Photo of victim healing
Sentencing hearing on January 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Court calls case at 8:39  a.m.
Defendant David Lorenz in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant David Lorenz in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Photo Exhibits #P1 thru P6 are marked.
Defendant waives right to a jury trial.  Court questions this waiver.  Atty Kryshak explains the Defendant's reasons for the waiver.  Court informs the Defendant of his rights and questions the waiver for jury trial.  Court finds defendant has freely and voluntarily waived his right to jury trial.
This matter will proceed today as a court trial.
ADA Knaapen calls first witness, Mathew Olmstead-emergency room doctor, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.  Exhibit #P7 is marked and referred to during direct exam.
8:48 a.m. Exhibit #P1 and P2 photos are referred to during direct exam.
8:51 a.m. Exhibit #P3 and P4 are referred to during direct exam.
8:59 a.m. Exhibit #P8 is marked and referred to during direct exam.
9:06 a.m. Cross exam by Atty Kryshak.  Exhibit #D9 is marked and referred to during cross exam.
9:11 a.m. Exhibit #D10 is marked and referred to during cross exam.
9:13 a.m. ADA Knaapen re-direct exam.
9:18 a.m. Atty Kryshak re-cross exam. Objection by ADA Knaapen, overruled.
9:18 a.m. witness rests and is excused.  ADA Knaapen requests exhibits P1, P2, P3, P4, P7, & P8 be received by the Court.  Court receives same exhibits.
9:21 a.m.  ADA Knaapen calls witness, Kristen Iniguez-pediatrician, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
9:29 a.m. Exhibit #P5 and P6 are referred to during direct exam.
9:36 a.m. Exhibit #P1 , P2, and P4 are referred to during direct exam.
9:40 a.m. Exhibit #P8 is referred to during direct exam.
9:44 a.m. Cross exam by Atty Kryshak.
9:47 a.m. Court questions the witness for clarifcation.
9:49 a.m. ADA Knaapen re-direct exam.
9:54 a.m. No further questions. Witness excused.  ADA calls next witness, Detective Nole, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
9:59 a.m. Court takes a short break so as to get the ADA laptop to work again.
10:12 a.m. Court back in session.  ADA Knaapen has a CD which will be marked Exhibit P11 video clip viewed starting at 13mins 13 sec on the CD and  and starting 12mins 30 sec on screen shows.
10:30 a.m. Cross exam by Atty Kryshak.  Exhibit #D12 marked and referred to during direct exam.  Defense exhibits are received.  Exhibit P11 is also received by the Court.
10:33 a.m. Atty Kryshak informs the Court that the Defendant states he will not be testifying.  Court informs the Defendant of his rights and questions his choice not to testify. Court finds defendant has freely and voluntarily waived his right to testify.
10:34 a.m. Final arguments of ADA Knaapen in support of 948.03(2)(a) Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm.
10:38 a.m. Final arguments of Atty Kryshak states feels this case is more applicable to 948.03(2)(c) Child Abuse-High Probability/Great Harm.
10:40 a.m.  ADA Knaapen rebuttal.
10:41 a.m. Court in recess for 10 - 15 mins.
11:08 a.m. Court in session. Court summerizes the facts that were presented.
BTC: Found Guilty of 948.03(2)(a) Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm. Clerk is to enter judgment of contiviction today.
PSI ordered.
Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Court trial on December 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant David Lorenz in court with attorney Gary J Kryshak. Defendant David Lorenz in custody. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Kryshak makes arguments in support of his motion to modify bond.  Defendant can make a reasonable cash bond.  The motion indicates he would be living in the area.  Parents can post, he would be moving back to his parents residence in Hazelhurst.  Conditions remain the same.  
Atty Knaapen makes arguments in opposition to the motion.  Due to severity of charges.  While no criminal record, defendant did not entirely cooperate with law enforcement.  Asks bond to remain as ordered. 
Atty Kryshak disagrees with statements made by Atty Knaapen.  Has no reason to believe why his client would not appear. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint. 

BY THE COURT: 
Motion is denied. 

Pre-trial will be moved to May 5th.
Bail/bond hearing on April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court calls case at 3:06 p.m. Defendant David Lorenz in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant David Lorenz in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are ready to proceed. ADA Knaapen calls witness, Detective Noel, is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. Parties stipulate to Defendant present in Courtroom today.
3:12 p.m. Atty Kryshak cross exam.
BTC:   Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued
Atty Kryshak asks that the Defendant be present at the Pretrial and Bond Motion Hearing. - granted.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
to Amend Bond

Defendant David Lorenz appeared by video.  Attorney Gary J Kryshak in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.
Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Kryshak

Clerk is Shelley P.
Court calls case at 4:47 p.m.
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Sean Drury makes special appearance for this defendant.  Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Atty Drury makes statements on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Child Abuse - Intentional Cause.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
Atty Knaapen states that the defendant had provided a false statement when questioned regarding this incident.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  Februray  17, 2014 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  With the family residence at 3521 Evergreen Drive, Plover, WI  54467; the family at this residence; the victim E.R.W. dob 05/16/12.
No unsupervised contact with any minors while this case is pending.
Will need to report alcohol/drug free to Day Report 7 days per week if defendant is able to post the cash bond.
